Trigger.Name: README - https://discordapp.com/channels/374517624228544512/399219257302450196/560323108263690251
Trigger.Description:
Illidra Ethorn - 27/03/2019 Player Marking Trigger
I made a neat player marking trigger that allows you to easily mark ffxiv players in your own triggers.
If you try to mark many players in quick succession, it'll queue up to prevent inputting too many actions at once.
Here it is: https://pastebin.com/zhC1ezqA
Setting it up: - Move the PlayerMarker folder to be under the Root folder: https://i.imgur.com/AjBeqo0.png - Ensure your triggernometry config is set up to order party members properly: https://i.imgur.com/mlyexNA.png - Set up a new hotbar in game with keybinds F1-F9 (you can utilize other keybinds, but you'll have to figure that out and modify the trigger on your own) - Make 9 macros in game with the following code: /mk attack <1> /mk attack <2> ... /mk attack <8> /merror off /mk clear <1> /mk clear <2> /mk clear <3> /mk clear <4> /mk clear <5> /mk clear <6> /mk clear <7> /mk clear <8>
- Set the /mk attack macros to be in order of the players they will mark (the /mk attack <1> macro will be on F1, etc...) - Set the /mk clear <1-8> macro to be on F9
Example of using it: https://i.imgur.com/MsXNtJE.png https://i.imgur.com/gpFVLlZ.png
Example Trigger: https://pastebin.com/McKWV0KH
To use the example trigger: Type in /e M4rk: (player name in your party) to mark them

Trigger.Name: ## README
Trigger.Description:
README
- Setup Steps for UCOB Triggers
1 - Copy the trigger "# UCOB Settings" in your startup folder
2 - Edit the Settings Trigger
3 - Edit the Image action and click on "use visual guide for placement"
4 - Right click on the image and "Save Changes" once it is where you want it
5 - Well Done !
FAQ : "What is the startup folder ???" - Read this install guide : https://github.com/Aho-Senpai/TEMP-SETUP-GUIDE/blob/master/README.md

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
Ingame commands: /echo !aashow /echo !aahide
In order to change the location of the progress bar, first copy this entire folder to local triggers or you can't edit anything. Don't have it enabled as a local and remote trigger at the same time!
To move the progress bar, switch to the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, double click the first action named "Move me!" and click the button saying "Use visual guide for placement". You can then drag it to whereever you want, save your selection with right click -> save and everything will automatically adjust to where you put it. If you move it while already enabled, you will need to use the /echo !aashow command again for it to update.
The trigger will show a progress bar displaying the time until your next auto attack is ready. Works exclusively for combat jobs and is intended for play at level 80 since lower levels weapons don't always have the same delay as level 80 weapons, I can't actually tell what your weapon delay is and just assume it's at the value that's standard for your job for current max level weapons.
The only auto attack speed effects the trigger will take into account are SAM/BLM/WHM/NIN/MNK/BRD haste effects so you will not see any slows enemies put on you properly reflected here since I'd need to implement each of those individually.
This trigger won't work within zone locked folders due to relying on network lines
If you break something tell me on discord, Aya#0847 --------------- Documentation on how auto attack edge cases work:
Haste effects being gained/lost between autos: Your next auto will happen based on the current haste effects - if you lose greased lightning 0.1s before an auto attack, that entire auto attack will be moved back as if you never had greased lightning. Conversely, gaining a haste effect does the opposite thing and moves the next auto forward in accordance with how potent that haste effect is - gaining a haste effect just before an auto that would have happened anyway soon will result in it happening instantly as you gain the effect. All this is reflected correctly in the trigger.
Casts: Using anything with a cast bar pauses your auto attack timer until you make it to the slidecast window and this behavior should work properly in the trigger.
Channels: Channeling something like improvisation on dancer simply disables your ability to auto attack but the timer will still progress as normal.
TCJ: Tracking the time until first auto after TCJ is not supported due to TCJ being extremely weird. The first auto attack after it will happen at the first possible time that is your auto delay + some whole number. For example, without huton your auto delay is 2.56 and your next auto after TCJ can only occur after 3.56s, 4.56s, 5.56s, 6.56s... etc. relative to the last auto before TCJ. As such, I simply don't know when your next auto will be until TCJ ends, at which point it will never take more than a full second for another auto attack to occur, implementing support for that is more effort than it's worth.

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
!! In order for this trigger to work, a HoT tick must have occured on your character since you last changed zones. !!
Ingame commands: /echo !tickshow /echo !tickhide
In order to change the location of the progress bar, first copy this entire folder to local triggers or you can't edit anything. Don't have it enabled as a local and remote trigger at the same time!
To move the progress bar to a different location, open the "Move me!" action in the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, click "Use visual guide for placement", move it to where you want and right click to save the location.

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description: This trigger calls out ghosted hits (i.e. abilities you casted but that didn't connect due to the boss becoming invulnerable or already being dead).
